intro: Oenone penicillata, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, often pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and a tall, branching stem. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Oenone penicillata plays a vital role in its ecosystem, providing nectar and habitat for various insects.
